memories.title: Alice Roydep
memories.description: We'll keep dancing at the Jane in our memories with you. I love you forever Josito <3

memories.title: Charlotte/Lottie
memories.description: José was warm, funny, handsome, always a bit cheeky and oh so smart. His infectious energy was something that you couldn’t help but take notice of. He had the brightest smile, an amazing laugh and gave the best bear hugs. And his Ali G quotes still make me laugh to this day! I feel lucky to have been in his class and grown up with him, from being just 10 year olds all the way up until graduation, and then living simultaneously in Paris for a few years. He was always a supportive friend especially when it came to my singing, cheering me on and showing up to several of my gigs during that time. There are so many memories from school and beyond that I will always cherish. José you were a great friend and a great human. I’ll miss you dearly ❤️ Charlotte/Lottie

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: Adding additional photos for my original entry 🧡🙏🏽

memories.title: Clotilde Guyot-Réchard
memories.description: Jose was the person with the biggest smile on earth. He would take care of the others like no one else and would share his energy and brightness around him. His brightness will remain with us. ♥️

memories.title: Farah
memories.description: Jose, I cannot remember how it all started but remember every little things after that. Our Parisian strolls, the sleepovers and our metaphysical discussions, from the existence of god to “can we truly love one person ?” with occasional ping-pongs and hip hop detours. Two firey and stubborn “North Africans” trying to have the last word but also looking for a place where we belong. But beyond all of that, you always made it a point to make others feel good about themselves and who they are. I loved your smile, the honesty of your voice and thoughts, your deep and curious intelligence, all the love you had to give (yes, indeed), your incredible connection with little humans who are far better than the bigger ones. I will forever cherish our time and will smile, ear to ear just like you, every-time I walk on rue de Turenne. Infinite love and light. Farah aka Faroushki

memories.title: Gabrielle Douieb
memories.description: Je me souviendrai toujours de ton sourire, ta joie, ton intelligence et ta gentillesse.

memories.title: George Ssamula
memories.description: We shall always love yoy, Jose.

memories.title: Hans B
memories.description: Jose was the center of every room. His huge smile and his endless energy were infectious. I remember so clearly how he was at the front of every conversation, every interaction, every adventure as we grew up. He was so curious about others—always genuine, always learning, always making friends. I think the pictures show that very clearly. He was truly one of a kind and I don't know anyone else like him. Jose, you will be sorely missed.

memories.title: Hara (Harouzi according to him)
memories.description: El 28 de junio de 2025, estaba volviendo de una semana de vacaciones con amigos, muy contenta y descansada. El 28 de junio de 2025, me estaba preparando para volver a mi casa en Dakar, donde compartimos tantas risas el y yo hace un par de años. El 28 de junio de 2025, me llamaron para anunciarme que se había ido… Mis manos temblando no me lo podía creer. José, Piski, Cookies, Fuity, Quicky, todos estos nombres distintos que llamaban a la misma persona. Una persona inteligente, cariñosa, abierta, con un sentido del humor que no tenía límite. Compartíamos una pasión por África del Oeste, con su obsesión por los datos y mapas de conflicto y desplazados. José Luengo Cabrera, este nombre que todavía es famoso en mi sector. Tenía tanto potencial para tener la vida de sus sueños, en París, trabajando para la OCDE, con 4 hijos y probablemente más de una mamita. Pero su salud mental tomó demasiado espacio y, al final, ganó ella. Que descanses, amigo mío, ahora no sufrirás más. Tu presencia se queda aquí porque viviras siempre en nuestros corazones.

memories.title: Ishita Mehta
memories.description: Jose, ofcourse you were fun to be around but you always tested me too from us making a pact to work for the UN/World Bank - a promise that only you could keep to testing my life decisions during a memorable weekend in Madrid for Carlos' wedding last year! You were a deep thinker, which I know was tough for you too. I pray your soul is now at peace. Memories with you will not diminish. I remember Day 1 at university we met at the amphitheatre and you were full of life, I remember you that way.

memories.title: Jess Fitch
memories.description: José, I am so glad to have had you in my life. I have such happy memories of you, from fun nights out at uni to hanging out together in Sydney - you hosting a royal wedding watch party, complete with tiaras, was a particular highlight.You were a delight to spend time with, so funny, charming and clever. You gave excellent life advice (“it is possible to be intelligent without being a p***k”) and practical advice. I hope you knew how special you were. You will be so missed. Bisous

memories.title: Lea, Joao, Santi & Ida
memories.description: Warm, passionate, funny, charming, we miss you and your stories already ❤️ you’ll always be in our hearts!

memories.title: Lena
memories.description: Thank you for being a part of my Warwick Fam - and for all the laughs, cuddles and moments we shared across the world. I’m so grateful that I met you at Warwick, and I could not believe my luck when we crossed paths again in Australia. You lit up the room, wherever you went. I’ll miss you José. x

memories.title: Lore
memories.description: El amor nos unió y aunque la vida nos separó físicamente nuestra amitad perduró para siempre, porque es  imposible no seguir conectada a ti, una persona con una luz que atrae y asi te voy a recordar siempre, te quiero, Bandido!

memories.title: Maria Moraru Fielding
memories.description: Dear Jose, I'm so sorry to hear about your passing. Why? I feel totally shocked and sad, thinking I should have written to you and continued our last conversation. You seemed to be doing well, excited for Christmas and happy with a quieter pace in Tenerife. I never imagined anything like this could happen to you. You always spoke about wanting kids - and would have made a great/modern/woke dad. You made an impact on so many people and had so many friends. Everyone loved you. It's a real loss for all of us. Everyone wondering what we could have done to help sooner. Thank you for saving me that one time my aunt's car broke down and for introducing me to Adrian - you always took credit for that :). I'll never forget our fun times in uni with everyone and I'll never forget you. Rest in peace, all my love and condolences to your mom and family <3

memories.title: Marie Carrez
memories.description: José tu es un ami cher, toujours attentionné profondément gentil. Tu es quelqu’un de brillant et drôle avec qui il était très facile de connecter et de discuter. Je pense fort à toi et tu vas me manquer.

memories.title: Moe Shahid
memories.description: Us at are our last food escapade together in February 2025. Love you brother.

memories.title: Natasha Jain
memories.description: To fathom a life without you in it is unimaginable. We are heartbroken beyond belief, and I don't think we will ever recover. You were the life and soul of every interaction you had with any human you met. Your smile had the ability to heal people. Your engulfing hugs made us feel like we were the safest. I'm sorry we couldn't do more for you, but we will never, ever forget you. I will forever long for talks, dinners, picnics, walks and new memories with you. I hope you have finally found peace, and are somewhere that is filled with joy and all the Latikas you wanted. We love you Jose ❤️💔

memories.title: Orla O’Halloran
memories.description: “It’s like an oven in there”. He’ll know what that means. I remember when neither of us could remember the English word for cinnamon. And when we hired the velib bikes and he didn’t realise you paid by the hour and put it in his apartment overnight claiming he’d joined the green revolution. “Does trimming count?” He’ll know what to at one means too. One of the best years of my life was punctuated by his fizzy and fabulous energy. 16 wonderful years of friendship with a true individual and a singularly generous and kind soul. You cared for me when I needed it and you opened my world to so many new experiences. I will miss you José. And that infectious smile. You lit up every room you entered. You are one in a million. Sometimes the brightest bulbs burn out the fastest. Your footprints remain on my heart. Love always xxx

memories.title: Philip T Ndamira
memories.description: Till we meet again my friend🙏🏾

memories.title: Rada Youssef
memories.description: There was no one like Jose. I could always count on his warmth and support. He was open hearted and available. Until we meet again, pops ❤️

memories.title: Saruchi
memories.description: Piski, dejaste en este mundo un hueco enorme que se ha llenado con toda esa gente a la que llenaste sus corazones y su vida con tu empatía, humor y generosidad. Abrazarte y poner la cabeza en tu pecho era un lugar seguro y reconfortante. Siempre estabas, desde cualquier lugar del mundo o momento del día. Eras capaz de ver y sacar lo bueno de cada persona. Unías a la gente. Hubieses llegado a liderar Naciones unidas, no tengo duda, y ahí hubieses unido naciones, como nos has unido a tantas personas. Ahora has creado una comunidad que se quedará unida por ti para siempre. Me reconforta pensar que quizás es esa comunidad la que te alargó la vida. Espero que tu alma haya encontrado paz, no sé si nosotros lleguemos a encontrarla, pero hay un poco de Piski en nuestros corazones, de tu forma de ver el mundo y la vida. Te quiero amigo, gracias por ver en mi siempre luz, y sacármela hasta cuando tú no encontrabas la tuya. Te llevo en mi corazón, en mi forma de pensar, de ser, de querer, y de vivir. Cuidaremos de tu madre.

memories.title: Stine
memories.description: You always gave it your all in life and embraced every person you met along the way with an open heart. You conquered the world, just as you said you would at 15 years old. I only wish the world could've given you all that you needed. Gateful for every cherished moment with you. You are so loved and will be immensely missed.

memories.title: Thomas Lee (Burny)
memories.description: José, it’s Burny. We were fortunate enough to meet all those years ago back at Warwick, living young and free lives and thick as thieves, especially in final year. Fast forward and our paths crossed again, over in Sydney where our friendship was rekindled, and we enjoyed many a meal, hike, weekend away and cookies…and you’d sleep in the sunshine whilst I swam in the sea. I could only get you in there once due to your fear of sharks in Australia. It was ever so hard to be in the same place as you thereafter, but a couple of London meets, and you idolising my children, filled my heart enough. Your smile lit up a room, and I’ve never known anyone who could be so silly, yet so hyper intelligent and intellectual at the switch of a button. Your warmth, generosity, loyalty, humour, openness and playfulness is what touches so many, in all corners of the globe that you’ve at one time called home. Your network is so vast, but you’ve often been the common thread that has linked me with others. The world was better because of you. Because of your love and your heart, because you were so good inside, and I’m going to miss this so dearly. It feels like eternity ago to be young and stupid with little agenda together and the years have rolled on…but not by enough. I will tell your nephew and niece (as you referred my kids) all about you, and if I can provide them as much love, and laughs as you gave others, I think I’ll be doing just fine. Rest easy my brother, I love you. Burny

memories.title: Alessandra
memories.description: he wasn’t at all surprised that I’d ended up in a science-related career. At work

memories.title: Alessandra
memories.description: remembering the bright

memories.title: Alice Roydep
memories.description: Jose was a kind, compassionate, fun person. He had a fierce intellect and cared immensely about the well being of others. We had some wonderful moments at university, and he was a great friend to me - my time at Warwick was richer as a result of his friendship. He met my children in January, and left a huge impression on them - playing with them on the beach, and chasing them around the pool. They talked about him for months afterwards. I am still struggling to process what has happened. It has made me more determined to check in on friends who I think may be struggling. Jose was a wonderful person who left a positive imprint on the world.

memories.title: Alice Roydep
memories.description: carefree-seeming) guy who was always ready with a hug

memories.title: Alice Roydep
memories.description: Fruity, cookie, XOooow, José… Que dire, si ce n’est que tu as été un vrai rayon de soleil dans ma vie. Un globe-trotteur, un cœur grand ouvert, un sourire qui illuminait tout… c’est tellement cuuuute, c’était tellement toi. Et toujours, à la fin : un beso. J’espère que là où tu es, tu as trouvé la paix. Que tu ne souffres plus. Et que tu continues à veiller sur nous, avec ce même regard tendre. Je te souhaite d’être bien, là où tu es. Et surtout… sache qu’on ne t’oublie pas, mon Xoooooow.

memories.title: Alice Roydep
memories.description: somehow we always managed to stay in touch. That was one of his many talents

memories.title: Aurore
memories.description: remembering the bright

memories.title: Aurore
memories.description: wise and knowledgeable beyond your years (you were the only one with the intellect to counter Monsieur Piccinin)

memories.title: Aurore
memories.description: Caro José, sono passati quasi vent’anni da quando ti ho visto l’ultima volta, ma seguivo i tuoi viaggi e il tuo lavoro tramite i vari social. La notizia mi ha colto davvero di sorpresa e lasciato un segno profondo. Ti ricordo e ricorderò sempre come quel ragazzo che sorrideva sempre quando eravamo in classe con Giovanni a Bruxelles. Riposa in pace, un abbraccio affettuoso ai tuoi cari.

memories.title: Aurore
memories.description: bringing so much energy. I hope you are at peace dear friend

memories.description: or rather they didnt have the privilege of meeting him. But his soul is in our hearts

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: by so many. I will always love you. I will keep speaking to you in the quiet moments when I think of you

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: I can still hear his la baaaaaarbe shouted in random moments

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: and maybe that’s why everything felt so breathtaking. You took me to a desert

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: we talked about everything: life

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: Dearest Jose, you brought me so much joy during our time at Warwick. You were always the life of the party, always ready for a good time and always pure and kind. I will miss hearing your stories in New York and your hilarious trump impressions. You will always be with us in spirit. Rest in power my dear friend. God bless your family and may they find the strength and power to get through this.

memories.title: Carlos Ortiz (FINAL VERSION)
memories.description: What a terrible loss- you were a good human, handsome, exceptionally smart- basically everything a mother and friend could ask for. There are many things that can never be explained in this life, but hope you are at peace. You will never be forgotten and your contribution to humanity, especially in conflict zones will live on.

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: amigo;-). In history class

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: con una sonrisa de oreja a oreja

memories.description: pretending to study in the library

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: he accomplished so much with his time on earth

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: Fruity, my friend. I always thought you were chasing something and it pains me that I never understood that in reality you were running. I still can't fathom that this happened and I wish I had understood your sufferings better so I could have been there for you more. I hope you have found peace and that you're as well surrounded now as you were throughout your amazing life. I'll never forget the times we spent together. Love you forever, rest well. ..Tom Berg

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: nuestra residencia. Comenzaba la 'orientation week'. Estaba desempaquetando mis cosas

memories.title: Carol
memories.description: we were at his studio in Le Marais

memories.title: Charlotte/Lottie
memories.description: José was such a wonderful friend and person. Anytime I saw him - I knew we were going to have a nice time together. I remember at school him always being such a bright and charismatic student who had a deep effect on those around him. I missed José when he wasn’t around as he had such a positive aura that was infectious and generous. People were drawn to him. I will miss him even more now - but in the knowledge that he had such a huge impact on those who knew him. Love, Colin.

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: I remember : We were 16 in the jamming room - John’s home. I didn't know how to say fruty or what’s this nickname meamns, so I improvised and invented the nickname cookie... and it stays forever.. “cookinou” we will miss you ❤️

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: carefree-seeming) guy who was always ready with a hug

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: amigo;-). In history class

memories.title: Claritta

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: Dearest Jose, you brought me so much joy during our time at Warwick. You were always the life of the party, always ready for a good time and always pure and kind. I will miss hearing your stories in New York and your hilarious trump impressions. You will always be with us in spirit. Rest in power my dear friend. God bless your family and may they find the strength and power to get through this.

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: quickly rose to the highest levels of global diplomacy at such a young age. From the door man to the president of any country; you treated everyone with the same respect

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: Dear José, I can't believe you are gone. When I think of you I see your big smile, laughter and those amazing hugs you would give. You were such a kind soul with a big heart. You showed so much care and love for others, and you managed to touch so many people during your too short life. I admired your drive, passion and dedication for social justice and for achieving your goals in life. I am forever grateful for the special moments we had together both at the European school in Brussels, at Warwick uni and in London. You were so much fun and such a wonderful friend, a great entertainer and dancer, and so intelligent and hard working all at the same time. I remember the fundraisers you succesfully organised both at the European school and at Warwick University for different social causes to support children and young people living in situations of poverty and hardship. You made this place a better world in so many ways, and it is a big loss for humanity to no longer have you with us. Will try my best to keep your spirit alive. Thank you for everything you gave me and all of us. My deepest condolences to your family and friends. Love, Marie

memories.title: Claritta
memories.description: I have such fond and vivid memories of our time together at university. You were so full of warmth and energy, with that big, unforgettable smile that always brightened my day. I admired your curiosity, your kindness, and your deep commitment to making the world a better place — a commitment you truly lived by. Although we didn’t keep closely in touch after university, you will always hold a special place in my heart. I feel so lucky to have shared that time with you.

memories.title: Davide
memories.description: What a terrible loss- you were a good human, handsome, exceptionally smart- basically everything a mother and friend could ask for. There are many things that can never be explained in this life, but hope you are at peace. You will never be forgotten and your contribution to humanity, especially in conflict zones will live on.

memories.title: Gabrielle Douieb
memories.description: José was one of the most outgoing, friendly, hard working, driven and ambitious people I had the pleasure of growing up with and of knowing. It’s heartbreaking to know of the pain he was going through behind that kind, brave face we knew and loved. His energy and positivity lifted everywhere he graced and everyone he met. We are lucky to have known him and to have had him in our lives. I hope his family and those closest to him can find some solace from knowing how many people José touched and inspired. You will be sorely missed. Rest in peace brother

memories.title: Gabrielle Douieb
memories.description: the peace you deserved so deeply. I know you’ll keep watching over us

memories.title: Gabrielle Douieb
memories.description: José was such a wonderful friend and person. Anytime I saw him - I knew we were going to have a nice time together. I remember at school him always being such a bright and charismatic student who had a deep effect on those around him. I missed José when he wasn’t around as he had such a positive aura that was infectious and generous. People were drawn to him. I will miss him even more now - but in the knowledge that he had such a huge impact on those who knew him. Love, Colin.

memories.title: Hans B
memories.description: it wasn’t simple. But I don’t think I’ve had many people in life look at me the way you always did. With genuine care. With sustained affection. With the presence of someone who stays

memories.title: Hara (Harouzi according to him)
memories.description: Dear José, you were funny, bright, warm, and so smart. I remember one day you spoke about ‘us Africans’ and I said, José, do you think of yourself as African? And you laughed and said, yes, I’m from the Canaries, I’m from Africa. It was a joy to work with you, it felt more like being in school together than being in a serious institution. So much love, Florence

memories.description: the peace you deserved so deeply. I know you’ll keep watching over us

memories.description: attentions and cuddles. I love the times we had together in NYC with our group in festivals

memories.title: Heena
memories.description: India and Italy. You encouraged and comforted me dearly when my longest relationship ended and were there encouraging me in person before having my first date after. In recent years

memories.title: Heena
memories.description: Jose was a kind, compassionate, fun person. He had a fierce intellect and cared immensely about the well being of others. We had some wonderful moments at university, and he was a great friend to me - my time at Warwick was richer as a result of his friendship. He met my children in January, and left a huge impression on them - playing with them on the beach, and chasing them around the pool. They talked about him for months afterwards. I am still struggling to process what has happened. It has made me more determined to check in on friends who I think may be struggling. Jose was a wonderful person who left a positive imprint on the world.

memories.title: Henning
memories.description: Fruity, my friend. I always thought you were chasing something and it pains me that I never understood that in reality you were running. I still can't fathom that this happened and I wish I had understood your sufferings better so I could have been there for you more. I hope you have found peace and that you're as well surrounded now as you were throughout your amazing life. I'll never forget the times we spent together. Love you forever, rest well. ..Tom Berg

memories.title: Henning
memories.description: amigo;-). In history class

memories.title: Henning
memories.description: proud and loud—he carried it everywhere he went. I will always remember your kindness. You spoke to me as a person

memories.title: Henning
memories.description: Fruity, my friend. I always thought you were chasing something and it pains me that I never understood that in reality you were running. I still can't fathom that this happened and I wish I had understood your sufferings better so I could have been there for you more. I hope you have found peace and that you're as well surrounded now as you were throughout your amazing life. I'll never forget the times we spent together. Love you forever, rest well. ..Tom Berg

memories.title: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)
memories.description: by so many. I will always love you. I will keep speaking to you in the quiet moments when I think of you
memories.contributor: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)

memories.title: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)
memories.description: Caro José, sono passati quasi vent’anni da quando ti ho visto l’ultima volta, ma seguivo i tuoi viaggi e il tuo lavoro tramite i vari social. La notizia mi ha colto davvero di sorpresa e lasciato un segno profondo. Ti ricordo e ricorderò sempre come quel ragazzo che sorrideva sempre quando eravamo in classe con Giovanni a Bruxelles. Riposa in pace, un abbraccio affettuoso ai tuoi cari.
memories.contributor: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)

memories.title: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)
memories.description: I knew José from the European School. We weren't close, but I remember him well. Most of all, I remember the moment I realized how brilliant he was: it was a normal morning in the school’s cafeteria, and while my friends and I were queuing to buy a couque au chocolat, José was organizing a fundraiser for an NGO where he planned to volunteer during the summer. I remember thinking to myself how exceptional that was and have admired him since then.  His charisma and boldness were already inspiring then, when we were but teenagers, and I am sure he has inspired many more since then. My thoughts go out to his family and friends. Isadora
memories.contributor: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)

memories.title: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)
memories.description: bringing so much energy. I hope you are at peace dear friend
memories.contributor: Isabella (aka Gracie, Piski's nickname for me)

memories.title: Isabella (or Gracie as Piski called me)
memories.description: José, how sad I was to hear of the news of you passing away. What a tragic loss to the world! At school, we were not particularly close, but in the same class at EE school, for all of secondary, meant something that bonds us all. You were always someone who I admired from a distance, most probably due to you being too 'cool' for me and so good-looking! I remember distinctly beeing invited to your 18th birthday party before our Baccalaureate and loosing my voice as I was singing and shouting and felt honoured to be there and felt so cool to have been part of that day. Rest in Peace José. Love, Hetta xx
memories.contributor: Isabella (or Gracie as Piski called me)

memories.title: Isabella (or Gracie as Piski called me)

I hope you have found peace and that you're as well surrounded now as you were throughout your amazing life. I'll never forget the times we spent together. Love you forever, rest well. ..Tom Berg

memories.title: Jackson Lemon
memories.description: What a terrible loss- you were a good human, handsome, exceptionally smart- basically everything a mother and friend could ask for. There are many things that can never be explained in this life, but hope you are at peace. You will never be forgotten and your contribution to humanity, especially in conflict zones will live on.

memories.title: Jackson Lemon
memories.description: Dear José, you were funny, bright, warm, and so smart. I remember one day you spoke about ‘us Africans’ and I said, José, do you think of yourself as African? And you laughed and said, yes, I’m from the Canaries, I’m from Africa. It was a joy to work with you, it felt more like being in school together than being in a serious institution. So much love, Florence

memories.description: by so many. I will always love you. I will keep speaking to you in the quiet moments when I think of you

memories.description: I can still hear his la baaaaaarbe shouted in random moments

memories.title: Jessie De Luca
memories.description: we were at his studio in Le Marais

memories.title: Jessie De Luca
memories.description: often visiting our home. You stood out

memories.title: Jessie De Luca
memories.description: José was one of the most outgoing, friendly, hard working, driven and ambitious people I had the pleasure of growing up with and of knowing. It’s heartbreaking to know of the pain he was going through behind that kind, brave face we knew and loved. His energy and positivity lifted everywhere he graced and everyone he met. We are lucky to have known him and to have had him in our lives. I hope his family and those closest to him can find some solace from knowing how many people José touched and inspired. You will be sorely missed. Rest in peace brother

memories.title: Lea, Joao, Santi & Ida
memories.description: José (Cookies) was always the one with biggest smile in the room. He also had catchphrases for every situations and could always makes us laugh. He was trully a good guy and good friend. I have only great memories of him. He will be dearly missed. I hope you are at peace now. Miss you.

memories.description: the kindest and most beautiful soul

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: carefree-seeming) guy who was always ready with a hug

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: always surrounded by friends (and all the girls!). You had this incredible ability to make me laugh

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: always surrounded by friends (and all the girls!). You had this incredible ability to make me laugh

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: I have such fond and vivid memories of our time together at university. You were so full of warmth and energy, with that big, unforgettable smile that always brightened my day. I admired your curiosity, your kindness, and your deep commitment to making the world a better place — a commitment you truly lived by. Although we didn’t keep closely in touch after university, you will always hold a special place in my heart. I feel so lucky to have shared that time with you.

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: and maybe that’s why everything felt so breathtaking. You took me to a desert

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: con una sonrisa de oreja a oreja

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: I can still hear his la baaaaaarbe shouted in random moments

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: José, how sad I was to hear of the news of you passing away. What a tragic loss to the world! At school, we were not particularly close, but in the same class at EE school, for all of secondary, meant something that bonds us all. You were always someone who I admired from a distance, most probably due to you being too 'cool' for me and so good-looking! I remember distinctly beeing invited to your 18th birthday party before our Baccalaureate and loosing my voice as I was singing and shouting and felt honoured to be there and felt so cool to have been part of that day. Rest in Peace José. Love, Hetta xx

memories.title: Margaux Mielcarek
memories.description: Dear José, I can't believe you are gone. When I think of you I see your big smile, laughter and those amazing hugs you would give. You were such a kind soul with a big heart. You showed so much care and love for others, and you managed to touch so many people during your too short life. I admired your drive, passion and dedication for social justice and for achieving your goals in life. I am forever grateful for the special moments we had together both at the European school in Brussels, at Warwick uni and in London. You were so much fun and such a wonderful friend, a great entertainer and dancer, and so intelligent and hard working all at the same time. I remember the fundraisers you succesfully organised both at the European school and at Warwick University for different social causes to support children and young people living in situations of poverty and hardship. You made this place a better world in so many ways, and it is a big loss for humanity to no longer have you with us. Will try my best to keep your spirit alive. Thank you for everything you gave me and all of us. My deepest condolences to your family and friends. Love, Marie

memories.title: Maria Moraru Fielding
memories.description: Fruity, cookie, XOooow, José… Que dire, si ce n’est que tu as été un vrai rayon de soleil dans ma vie. Un globe-trotteur, un cœur grand ouvert, un sourire qui illuminait tout… c’est tellement cuuuute, c’était tellement toi. Et toujours, à la fin : un beso. J’espère que là où tu es, tu as trouvé la paix. Que tu ne souffres plus. Et que tu continues à veiller sur nous, avec ce même regard tendre. Je te souhaite d’être bien, là où tu es. Et surtout… sache qu’on ne t’oublie pas, mon Xoooooow.

memories.title: Maria Moraru Fielding
memories.description: and generously shared. That love flowed towards my children

memories.title: Maria Moraru Fielding
memories.description: Fruity, cookie, XOooow, José… Que dire, si ce n’est que tu as été un vrai rayon de soleil dans ma vie. Un globe-trotteur, un cœur grand ouvert, un sourire qui illuminait tout… c’est tellement cuuuute, c’était tellement toi. Et toujours, à la fin : un beso. J’espère que là où tu es, tu as trouvé la paix. Que tu ne souffres plus. Et que tu continues à veiller sur nous, avec ce même regard tendre. Je te souhaite d’être bien, là où tu es. Et surtout… sache qu’on ne t’oublie pas, mon Xoooooow.

memories.title: Maria Moraru Fielding
memories.description: José was such a wonderful friend and person. Anytime I saw him - I knew we were going to have a nice time together. I remember at school him always being such a bright and charismatic student who had a deep effect on those around him. I missed José when he wasn’t around as he had such a positive aura that was infectious and generous. People were drawn to him. I will miss him even more now - but in the knowledge that he had such a huge impact on those who knew him. Love, Colin.

memories.title: Marie Carrez
memories.description: José was one of the most outgoing, friendly, hard working, driven and ambitious people I had the pleasure of growing up with and of knowing. It’s heartbreaking to know of the pain he was going through behind that kind, brave face we knew and loved. His energy and positivity lifted everywhere he graced and everyone he met. You will be sorely missed. Rest in peace brother

memories.title: Nnamdi, Ayana, and Anisia
memories.description: Dearest Jose, you brought me so much joy during our time at Warwick. You were always the life of the party, always ready for a good time and always pure and kind. I will miss hearing your stories in New York and your hilarious trump impressions. You will always be with us in spirit. Rest in power my dear friend. God bless your family and may they find the strength and power to get through this.

textMemories.text: Caro José, sono passati quasi vent’anni da quando ti ho visto l’ultima volta, ma seguivo i tuoi viaggi e il tuo lavoro tramite i vari social. La notizia mi ha colto davvero di sorpresa e lasciato un segno profondo. Ti ricordo e ricorderò sempre come quel ragazzo che sorrideva sempre quando eravamo in classe con Giovanni a Bruxelles. Riposa in pace, un abbraccio affettuoso ai tuoi cari.
textMemories.author: Alessandro Zandonà

textMemories.text: we talked about everything: life

textMemories.text: attentions and cuddles. I love the times we had together in NYC with our group in festivals
textMemories.author: I feel I was so lucky to meet you when I arrived in NYC. You were the most welcoming and joyful person I had ever met. Always up to do anything (whatever the time and place)

textMemories.text: un sourire qui illuminait tout… et elles te voulaient toutes près d’elles
textMemories.author: Un globe-trotteur

textMemories.text: c’était tellement toi. Et toujours
textMemories.author: Puis j’ai eu mes enfants

textMemories.text: Fruity, cookie, XOooow, José… Que dire, si ce n’est que tu as été un vrai rayon de soleil dans ma vie. Un globe-trotteur, un cœur grand ouvert, un sourire qui illuminait tout… c’est tellement cuuuute, c’était tellement toi. Et toujours, à la fin : un beso. J’espère que là où tu es, tu as trouvé la paix. Que tu ne souffres plus. Et que tu continues à veiller sur nous, avec ce même regard tendre. Je te souhaite d’être bien, là où tu es. Et surtout… sache qu’on ne t’oublie pas, mon Xoooooow.
textMemories.author: Aurore Adriaans

textMemories.text: I can still hear his la baaaaaarbe shouted in random moments
textMemories.author: Even if we lost touch in recent years

textMemories.text: José was such a wonderful friend and person. Anytime I saw him - I knew we were going to have a nice time together. I remember at school him always being such a bright and charismatic student who had a deep effect on those around him. I missed José when he wasn’t around as he had such a positive aura that was infectious and generous. People were drawn to him. I will miss him even more now - but in the knowledge that he had such a huge impact on those who knew him. Love, Colin.
textMemories.author: Colin Senez

textMemories.text: somehow we always managed to stay in touch. That was one of his many talents
textMemories.author: I don’t have many people still in my life from the time I was 7 years old

textMemories.text: pero también situaciones difíciles. Nos reímos juntos
textMemories.author: Nuestro primer encuentro fue como un huracán. Te conocí con toda la energía positiva explosiva que solo tú lograbas traer a un lugar. El primer día de LSE forjamos una amistad que durará para la próxima década

textMemories.text: Dear José, you were funny, bright, warm, and so smart. I remember one day you spoke about ‘us Africans’ and I said, José, do you think of yourself as African? And you laughed and said, yes, I’m from the Canaries, I’m from Africa. It was a joy to work with you, it felt more like being in school together than being in a serious institution. So much love, Florence
textMemories.author: Florence  Gaub

textMemories.text: and maybe that’s why everything felt so breathtaking. You took me to a desert
textMemories.author: It was your favourite place on earth

textMemories.text: but was often bothered by your challenging statements. I appreciated your affection
textMemories.author: Nothing about either of us was straightforward

textMemories.text: it wasn’t simple. But I don’t think I’ve had many people in life look at me the way you always did. With genuine care. With sustained affection. With the presence of someone who stays
textMemories.author: You were one of those rare ones who take action and show up

textMemories.text: I have such fond and vivid memories of our time together at university. You were so full of warmth and energy, with that big, unforgettable smile that always brightened my day. I admired your curiosity, your kindness, and your deep commitment to making the world a better place — a commitment you truly lived by. Although we didn’t keep closely in touch after university, you will always hold a special place in my heart. I feel so lucky to have shared that time with you.
textMemories.author: Ghiz

textMemories.text: despite us not having spoken for so long. Not time

textMemories.text: the kindest and most beautiful soul
textMemories.author: You were one of my closest friends

textMemories.text: José, how sad I was to hear of the news of you passing away. What a tragic loss to the world! At school, we were not particularly close, but in the same class at EE school, for all of secondary, meant something that bonds us all. You were always someone who I admired from a distance, most probably due to you being too 'cool' for me and so good-looking! I remember distinctly beeing invited to your 18th birthday party before our Baccalaureate and loosing my voice as I was singing and shouting and felt honoured to be there and felt so cool to have been part of that day. Rest in Peace José. Love, Hetta xx
textMemories.author: Hetta

textMemories.text: made friends with everyone
textMemories.author: I may not remember the exact day we met at Warwick

textMemories.text: What a terrible loss- you were a good human, handsome, exceptionally smart- basically everything a mother and friend could ask for. There are many things that can never be explained in this life, but hope you are at peace. You will never be forgotten and your contribution to humanity, especially in conflict zones will live on.
textMemories.author: Ikaba Koyi

textMemories.text: by so many. I will always love you. I will keep speaking to you in the quiet moments when I think of you
textMemories.author: I use the word love so much because you were so full of love Piski

textMemories.text: I knew José from the European School. We weren't close, but I remember him well. Most of all, I remember the moment I realized how brilliant he was: it was a normal morning in the school’s cafeteria, and while my friends and I were queuing to buy a couque au chocolat, José was organizing a fundraiser for an NGO where he planned to volunteer during the summer. I remember thinking to myself how exceptional that was and have admired him since then.  His charisma and boldness were already inspiring then, when we were but teenagers, and I am sure he has inspired many more since then. My thoughts go out to his family and friends. Isadora
textMemories.author: Isadora

textMemories.text: carefree-seeming) guy who was always ready with a hug
textMemories.author: First—thank you. Thank you for the memories and the lasting impact you made on me. When I think of you

He was trully a good guy and good friend. I have only great memories of him. He will be dearly missed. I hope you are at peace now. Miss you.
textMemories.author: Johan Buck

textMemories.text: charisma and beaming energy. From the early days of eating tortillas at your house
textMemories.author: You were always the life of the party: big smiles

textMemories.text: quickly rose to the highest levels of global diplomacy at such a young age. From the door man to the president of any country; you treated everyone with the same respect
textMemories.author: Your talents and potential were immeasurable. You traveled the world

textMemories.text: wise and knowledgeable beyond your years (you were the only one with the intellect to counter Monsieur Piccinin)
textMemories.author: You were only 8 years old. But for me

textMemories.text: José was one of the most outgoing, friendly, hard working, driven and ambitious people I had the pleasure of growing up with and of knowing. It’s heartbreaking to know of the pain he was going through behind that kind, brave face we knew and loved. His energy and positivity lifted everywhere he graced and everyone he met. We are lucky to have known him and to have had him in our lives. I hope his family and those closest to him can find some solace from knowing how many people José touched and inspired. You will be sorely missed. Rest in peace brother
textMemories.author: Karl Sexton

textMemories.text: we were at his studio in Le Marais
textMemories.author: What I’ll remember most is when José helped me with French. He took time to help me with a reading I was quite nervous about in front of class. I’ll never forget it somehow. He was so good to me and just a ray of sunshine in my life especially in my school days. That’s how I’ll remember him. We connected over basketball too. More recently we’d go back and forth in messages about the NBA. The last message being a comment on my post about LeBron and Luka playing together in March of this year. Little messages that kept our friendship alive are now even more precious to me. The photo I’m sharing is from when we spent Thanksgiving together in 2014 in Paris with some other friends from school

textMemories.text: You're my mirror. Love you bro x
textMemories.author: Kumi aka Raaz Prince

textMemories.text: amigo;-). In history class
textMemories.author: Our shared love for tennis was the glue that brought us together and always fueled playful banter between us (yes

textMemories.text: to reconnecting in Paris
textMemories.author: You’ve always been—and will always remain—one of my closest friends and favorite people in the world. Life took us on so many unforgettable adventures over 15 years

textMemories.text: always surrounded by friends (and all the girls!). You had this incredible ability to make me laugh
textMemories.author: You were always so full of life—charismatic

textMemories.text: Dear José, I can't believe you are gone. When I think of you I see your big smile, laughter and those amazing hugs you would give. You were such a kind soul with a big heart. You showed so much care and love for others, and you managed to touch so many people during your too short life. I admired your drive, passion and dedication for social justice and for achieving your goals in life. I am forever grateful for the special moments we had together both at the European school in Brussels, at Warwick uni and in London. You were so much fun and such a wonderful friend, a great entertainer and dancer, and so intelligent and hard working all at the same time. I remember the fundraisers you succesfully organised both at the European school and at Warwick University for different social causes to support children and young people living in situations of poverty and hardship. You made this place a better world in so many ways, and it is a big loss for humanity to no longer have you with us. Will try my best to keep your spirit alive. Thank you for everything you gave me and all of us. My deepest condolences to your family and friends. Love, Marie
textMemories.author: Marie Sophie Pettersson

textMemories.text: Dearest Jose, you brought me so much joy during our time at Warwick. You were always the life of the party, always ready for a good time and always pure and kind. I will miss hearing your stories in New York and your hilarious trump impressions. You will always be with us in spirit. Rest in power my dear friend. God bless your family and may they find the strength and power to get through this.
textMemories.author: Muzzy

textMemories.text: and sharp—a brilliant mind and an even brighter soul. But above all
textMemories.author: Fiery

textMemories.text: and generously shared. That love flowed towards my children
textMemories.author: Our friendship transcended borders and time zones. It was rooted in love—deep

textMemories.author: Yo acababa de llegar con mis padres

textMemories.text: you could talk to him about anything
textMemories.author: Jose was larger than life. Made his presence felt wherever he went but always created room for others to shine. He loved nothing more to celebrate you in your success. No subject was off topic

textMemories.text: he accomplished so much with his time on earth
textMemories.author: A self-described “Bougie bitch”

textMemories.text: often visiting our home. You stood out
textMemories.author: I remember you from our teenage years

textMemories.text: pretending to study in the library
textMemories.author: I'll always remember meeting you for the first time in Paris in 2010 and then us two becoming inseparable in our final year at university and then on to LSE. I'll cherish forever memories of crashing on your floor on campus

textMemories.text: India and Italy. You encouraged and comforted me dearly when my longest relationship ended and were there encouraging me in person before having my first date after. In recent years
textMemories.author: From there we always made time for each other

textMemories.text: the peace you deserved so deeply. I know you’ll keep watching over us
textMemories.author: I truly hope that wherever you are now

textMemories.text: Jose was a kind, compassionate, fun person. He had a fierce intellect and cared immensely about the well being of others. We had some wonderful moments at university, and he was a great friend to me - my time at Warwick was richer as a result of his friendship. He met my children in January, and left a huge impression on them - playing with them on the beach, and chasing them around the pool. They talked about him for months afterwards. I am still struggling to process what has happened. It has made me more determined to check in on friends who I think may be struggling. Jose was a wonderful person who left a positive imprint on the world.
textMemories.author: Tim knight

textMemories.text: Fruity, my friend. I always thought you were chasing something and it pains me that I never understood that in reality you were running. I still can't fathom that this happened and I wish I had understood your sufferings better so I could have been there for you more. I hope you have found peace and that you're as well surrounded now as you were throughout your amazing life. I'll never forget the times we spent together. Love you forever, rest well. ..Tom Berg
textMemories.author: Tom Berg
